result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JIMMIE L RICHARDSON

defendant.name: RICHARDSON, JIMMIE L
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt: Second appearance on November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:02 PM Defendant JIMMIE L RICHARDSON in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes the defendant does not yet have counsel. Court questions the defendant on if he'd like to proceed with the preliminary hearing without counsel or waive the time limits so counsel can be present at his preliminary hearing. Defendant states he would like to waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing so he can have counsel present. Court sets Status of Counsel for November 7, 2022 at 3:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 1:05 PM.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for JIMMIE L RICHARDSON
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 2942 N 54th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.

1:04 PM Defendant JIMMIE L RICHARDSON in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson appeared by video for the defendant. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Nelson and defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is not to possess any firearms. If it appears as if the defendant may not be revoked, Court may revisit bond at that time. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary hearing November 1, 2022 at 11:30 AM. Court sets Status of Preliminary Hearing for October 31, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 1:09 AM
